content.p: [§245-37] Sale or purchase of packages of cigarettes without stamps; fines and penalties. (a) Beginning April 1, 2001, a person shall be guilty of a class C felony if the person: (1) Is not a licensee, and knowingly possesses, keeps, stores, acquires, or transports three thousand or more cigarettes that do not have stamps affixed to the cigarette packages as required by this part; or (2) Knowingly sells one thousand or more cigarettes that do not have stamps affixed to the cigarette packages as required by this part. (b) Beginning April 1, 2001, a person shall be guilty of a misdemeanor if the person: (1) Is not a licensee, and knowingly possesses, keeps, stores, acquires, or transports one thousand or more cigarettes that do not have stamps affixed to the cigarette packages as required by this part; or (2) Knowingly sells less than one thousand cigarettes that do not have stamps affixed to the cigarette packages as required by this part. (c) In addition to any other authorized disposition, a corporation found in violation of: (1) Subsection (a) is subject to a fine in an amount not to exceed $50,000; and (2) Subsection (b) is subject to a fine in an amount not to exceed $25,000. [L 2000, c 249, pt of §1, §20(2); am L 2002, c 94, §3] Previous Vol04_Ch0201-0257 Next
Beginning April 1, 2001, a person shall be guilty of a class C felony if the person:

Is not a licensee, and knowingly possesses, keeps, stores, acquires, or transports three thousand or more cigarettes that do not have stamps affixed to the cigarette packages as required by this part; or
Knowingly sells one thousand or more cigarettes that do not have stamps affixed to the cigarette packages as required by this part.
Beginning April 1, 2001, a person shall be guilty of a misdemeanor if the person:

Is not a licensee, and knowingly possesses, keeps, stores, acquires, or transports one thousand or more cigarettes that do not have stamps affixed to the cigarette packages as required by this part; or
Knowingly sells less than one thousand cigarettes that do not have stamps affixed to the cigarette packages as required by this part.
In addition to any other authorized disposition, a corporation found in violation of:
is subject to a fine in an amount not to exceed $50,000; and
is subject to a fine in an amount not to exceed $25,000. [L 2000, c 249, pt of §1, §20(2); am L 2002, c 94, §3] Previous Vol04_Ch0201-0257 Next
